packet.comment: Visited zones for the player ?
(unencrypted/uncompressed) First packet sent when connecting to new zone.

data.name: Movement Speed
data.comment: Speed 0x32 represents 100%

data.name: Animation Speed
data.comment: Speed 0x32 represents 100%

data.name: Menu Zone
data.comment: Only set if the menu ID is sent, used as the zone for menu responses (0x5b, 0x5c)

packet.comment: Packet contains IP and port of next zone to connect to.
Packet contains info about another PC (i.e. coordinates).

data.name: Bit1: Status
data.comment: -- 0A:1 Not used for 0x00D

data.name: Bit2: Vitals
data.comment: -- 0A:2 HP%, Status, Flags, LS color, Face Flags

data.name: Movement Speed
data.comment: 0x32 represents 100%

data.name: Animation Speed
data.comment: 0x32 represents 100%

data.name: Bit0: AccLvBit1
data.comment: Bit 1 + 2 defines GM level if GM level is set

data.name: Bit1: AccLvBit2
data.comment: Shows trial account of these are set without GM

data.name: Bit2: GM Mode
data.comment: Toggles GM mode on, use with Bit 1 + 2 to get higher-level GM icons/levels. 0=GM, 1=SeniorGM, 2=LeadGM, 3=Producer

packet.comment: Packet contains info about another PC (i.e. coordinates).

data.name: Walk Count
data.comment: Steadily increases until rotation changes. Does not reset while the mob isn't walking. Only goes until 0xFF1F.

packet.comment: Packet contains data about incoming chat messages
Job Levels and levels unlocked

data.name: _unknown1
data.comment: -- 04 Observed value of 05

data.name: _unknown3
data.comment: -- 10 Flag or List Start

data.name: _unknown4
data.comment: -- 2E Flags and junk? Hard to say. All 0s observed.

data.name: _unknown5
data.comment: -- 48 Potential flag to signal the list start. Observed value of 01

data.name: Encumbrance Flags
data.comment: -- 60 [legs, hands, body, head, ammo, range, sub, main,] [back, right_ring, left_ring, right_ear, left_ear, waist, neck, feet] [HP, CHR, MND, INT, AGI, VIT, DEX, STR,] [X X X X X X X MP]

packet.comment: Describes number of slots in inventory.

data.name: Active Inventory
data.comment: --14 These dupe sizes are set to 0 if the inventory disabled.

data.name: Active Storage
data.comment: -- 18 The accumulated storage from all items (uncapped) -1

data.name: Active Wardrobe 3
data.comment: -- 2A This is not set to 0 despite being disabled for whatever reason

data.name: Active Wardrobe 4
data.comment: -- 2C This is not set to 0 despite being disabled for whatever reason

packet.comment: Finish listing the items in inventory.
Modifies items in your inventory
Assigns an ID to equipped items in your inventory.
Info about item in your inventory.
Sent when somebody offers to trade with you.
Sent whenever something happens with the trade window.
Sent when an item appears in the trade window.

data.name: Trade Count
data.comment: -- 08 Seems to increment every time packet 0x023 comes in, i.e. every trade action performed by the other party

data.name: Item
data.comment: -- 0A If the item is removed, gil is used with a count of zero

data.name: _unknown1
data.comment: Might be junk, seems to be 0x05

data.name: Trade Slot
data.comment: Gil is slot 0, then 1-4 for top and 5-8 for bottom row

packet.comment: Sent when the server will allow you to trade an item.

data.name: Item
data.comment: -- 08 If the item is removed, gil is used with a count of zero

data.name: Trade Slot
data.comment: -- 0A Gil itself is in slot 0, whereas the other slots start at 1 and count up horizontally

packet.comment: It counts to 80 and does not have any obvious function. May have something to do with populating inventory.

data.name: _unknown1
data.comment: Seems to be 0x00

data.name: _unknown2
data.comment: Seems to be 0

packet.comment: Message that includes a string as a parameter.

data.name: Player ID
data.comment: -- 04 0x0112413A in Omen, 0x010B7083 in Legion, Layer Reserve ID for Ambuscade queue, 0x01046062 for Chocobo circuit

data.name: Player Index
data.comment: --08 0x013A in Omen, 0x0083 in Legion , Layer Reserve Index for Ambuscade queue, 0x0062 for Chocobo circuit

data.name: Message Type
data.comment: -- 0C 0x04 for Fishing/Salvage, 0x05 for Omen/Legion/Ambuscade queue/Chocobo Circuit

data.name: Parameter 1
data.comment: -- 10 Parameter 0 on the display messages dat items

data.name: Parameter 2
data.comment: -- 14 Parameter 1 on the display messages dat items

data.name: Parameter 3
data.comment: -- 18 Parameter 2 on the display messages dat items

data.name: Parameter 4
data.comment: -- 1C Parameter 3 on the display messages dat items

packet.comment: Packet sent when an NPC is attacking.
Packet sent for simple battle-related messages.
Packet sent when you rest in Abyssea.

data.name: Message ID
data.comment: -- 1A The high bit is occasionally set, though the reason for it is unclear.

packet.comment: Packet sent when you gain XP/LP/CP/JP/MP, advance RoE objectives, etc. by defeating a mob.

data.name: Target ID
data.comment: -- 08 Player ID in the case of RoE log updates

data.name: Target Index
data.comment: -- 0E Player Index in the case of RoE log updates

data.name: Param 1
data.comment: -- 10 EXP gained, etc. Numerator for RoE objectives

data.name: Param 2
data.comment: -- 14 Denominator for RoE objectives

data.name: _flags?
data.comment: -- 1A This could also be a third parameter, but I suspect it is flags because I have only ever seen one bit set.

packet.comment: Sent when talking to moogle inside mog house.
Generates the chocobo digging animation

data.name: Animation
data.comment: -- 0A Changing it to anything other than 1 eliminates the animation

data.name: _junk?
data.comment: -- 0B Likely junk. Has no effect on anything notable.

packet.comment: Generates the synthesis animation

data.name: Animation
data.comment: -- 0D -- Always C2 for me.

data.name: _unknown?
data.comment: -- 0E -- Appears to just be trash.

packet.comment: List of recipes or materials needed for a recip
Occurs before menus and some cutscenes

data.name: Event ID
data.comment: -- 0C Seems to select between menus within a zone

data.name: _unknown
data.comment: Seems to be 0

packet.comment: Triggers a menu or cutscene to appear. Contains 4 strings.

data.name: _unknown?
data.comment: -- 0E Looks like 0000 or 0800

data.name: Menu Parameters
data.comment: -- 50 The way this information is interpreted varies by menu.

packet.comment: Occurs before menus and some cutscenes

data.name: _unknown?
data.comment: -- 2E Usually 8, but often not for newer menus

packet.comment: Dialog from NPC's.

data.name: _junk?
data.comment: -- 0C Probably junk

packet.comment: Updates a characters stats and animation.

data.name: _flags1
data.comment: -- 28 Called Flags on the old dev wiki. Second byte might not be part of the flags, actually.

data.name: Bit1: Also despawns
data.comment: -- Also despawns your character, and may trigger an outgoing packet to the server (which triggers an incoming 0x037 packet)

data.name: MoveSpeed/2 bit1-8
data.comment: -- 2C Player movement speed

data.name: Yalms/step bit1-8
data.comment: -- 2E Determines how quickly your animation walks

data.name: Time offset?
data.comment: -- 3C For me, this is the number of seconds in 66 hours

data.name: Timestamp
data.comment: -- 40 This is 32 years off of JST at the time the packet is sent.

data.name: _flags
data.comment: -- 5C Two least significant bits seem to indicate whether Wardrobes 3 and 4, respectively, are enabled

packet.comment: Sent when a model should play a specific animation.

data.name: Type
data.comment: -- 0C Four character animation name

packet.comment: Sent to force animations to specific objects

data.name: Type
data.comment: -- 0C Four character animation name

packet.comment: Used for arbitrary battle animations that are unaccompanied by an action packet.

data.name: Animation Type
data.comment: -- 12 0 = magic, 1 = item, 2 = JA, 3 = environmental animations, etc.

data.name: _junk?
data.comment: -- 13 Deleting this has no effect

packet.comment: Displays items in a vendors shop.
Returns the value of an item.

data.name: _unknown?
data.comment: Seems to be 1

packet.comment: Opens the buy/sell menu for vendors.
Sent when you buy something from normal vendors.

data.name: _unknown?
data.comment: -- 06 First byte always seems to be 1, second byte varies between 0 and 1? Unclear correlation to anything.

packet.comment: Contains player ID and name for blacklist.

data.name: _unknown?
data.comment: Should be 3

packet.comment: Sent in response to /blacklist add or /blacklist delete.

data.name: Account ID
data.comment: Note, this is not the Player ID

packet.comment: Contains information about Automaton stats and set Blue Magic spells.

data.name: Automaton Head
data.comment: -- 08 Harlequinn 1, Valoredge 2, Sharpshot 3, Stormwaker 4, Soulsoother 5, Spiritreaver 6

data.name: Automaton Frame
data.comment: -- 09 Harlequinn 20, Valoredge 21, Sharpshot 22, Stormwaker 23

data.name: Attachment Slot 1
data.comment: -- 0A Attachment assignments are based off their position in the equipment list. Strobe is 01, etc.

data.name: Available Heads
data.comment: -- 18 Flags for the available heads (Position corresponds to Item ID shifted down by 8192)

data.name: Available Bodies
data.comment: -- 1C Flags for the available bodies (Position corresponds to Item ID)

data.name: Available Fire Attachments
data.comment: -- 38 Flags for the available Fire Attachments (Position corresponds to Item ID)

data.name: Available Ice Attachments
data.comment: -- 3C Flags for the available Ice Attachments (Position corresponds to Item ID)

data.name: Available Wind Attachments
data.comment: -- 40 Flags for the available Wind Attachments (Position corresponds to Item ID)

data.name: Available Earth Attachments
data.comment: -- 44 Flags for the available Earth Attachments (Position corresponds to Item ID)

data.name: Available Thunder Attachments
data.comment: -- 48 Flags for the available Thunder Attachments (Position corresponds to Item ID)

data.name: Available Water Attachments
data.comment: -- 4C Flags for the available Water Attachments (Position corresponds to Item ID)

data.name: Available Light Attachments
data.comment: -- 50 Flags for the available Light Attachments (Position corresponds to Item ID)

data.name: Available Dark Attachments
data.comment: -- 54 Flags for the available Dark Attachments (Position corresponds to Item ID)

packet.comment: Response to a translate request.

data.name: Autotranslate Code
data.comment: -- 04 In a 6 byte autotranslate code, these are the 5th and 4 bytes respectively.

data.name: Translated Phrase
data.comment: -- 48 Will be 00'd if no match was found.

packet.comment: The data that is sent to the client when it is Downloading data...

Info about equipment and appearance.
Allows your PC to move after interacting with an NPC.
The annoying message that tells how much time till you logout.
Updates your key item log on zone and when appropriate.

data.name: KeyItem List Type
data.comment: -- 84 Goes from 0 to 5, determines which KI are being sent

data.name: Has Keyitems (bits)
data.comment: -- 44 Bit field correlating to the previous, 1 if KI has been examined, 0 otherwise

packet.comment: Updates your quest and mission log on zone and when appropriate
Updates the weather effect when the weather changes
Locks your target
This packet is the server's response to a client /emote

data.name: Motion
data.comment: -- 16 2 for motion, 0 otherwise

packet.comment: Server packet sent when a new mob spawns in area
Used when all the information required for a menu cannot be fit in an NPC Interaction packet
Contains information about Campaign and Besieged status
Changes the current music
Packet contains a lot of data about your character's stats

data.name: _unknown?
data.comment: Always 0 ?

data.name: _unknown?
data.comment: I'm gonna guess ranged iLevel?

data.name: _unknown?
data.comment: -- 58 Danger, 00ing caused my client to crash

data.name: _unknown?
data.comment: -- 5A No obvious function

packet.comment: Packet that shows your weapon and magic skill stats
Frequently sent packet during battle that updates specific types of job information, like currently available/set automaton equipment and currently set BLU spells

data.name: Update Type
data.comment: Seems to say what type of info this packet contains to update

data.name: _species?
data.comment: -- 08 Vary when I change species

data.name: _flag?
data.comment: -- 0A Consistent across species

data.name: Monster Level Fields
data.comment: -- 5C Mapped onto the item ID for these creatures. (00 doesn't exist, 01 is rabbit, 02 is behemoth, etc.)

data.name: _unknown?
data.comment: -- 08 FF-ing has no effect.

data.name: Instinct Bitfields 3
data.comment: -- 88 Contains job/race instincts from the 0x03 set. Has 8 unused bytes. This is a 1:1 mapping.

data.name: Variants Bitfields
data.comment: -- 94 Does not show normal monsters, only variants. Bit is 1 if the variant is owned. Length is an estimation including the possible padding.

data.name: _unknown?
data.comment: -- 08 Lowest bit of this might indicate JP availability

packet.comment: Moves your character. Seems to be functionally idential to the Spawn packet

data.name: _unknown?
data.comment: -- 16 1 observed. May indicate repositoning type.

data.name: _unknown?
data.comment: -- 17 Unknown, but matches the same byte of a matching spawn packet

packet.comment: Updates information about whether or not you have a pet and the TP, HP, etc. of the pet if appropriate

data.name: Chocobo Speed Mod
data.comment: -- 19:5 speed_mod + 32, server: speed_mod = strength rank(7) + gallop(1) + purple racing silks(1) cap:8

data.name: Chocobo Riding Time Mod
data.comment: -- 1A:5 time_mod * 240 + 60, server: time_mod = (endurance rank(7) + canter(1) cap@7) + orange racing silks(1) + 4 cap:11

packet.comment: Updates information about whether or not you have a pet and the TP, HP, etc. of the pet if appropriate
Results of an attempted synthesis process by yourself

data.name: Count
data.comment: Even set on fails

packet.comment: Results of an attempted synthesis process by others

data.name: Count
data.comment: Even set on fails

packet.comment: Populates the Campaign map
Creates the timer and glowing fence that accompanies Unity fights

data.name: Fight Designation
data.comment: -- 04 Anything other than 0 makes a timer. 0 deletes the timer.

data.name: Timestamp Offset
data.comment: -- 08 Number of seconds since 15:00:00 GMT 31/12/2002 (0x3C307D70)

data.name: Position?
data.comment: -- 10 This packet clearly needs position information, but it's unclear how these bytes carry it

data.name: Battlefield Radius
data.comment: -- 1C Yalms*1000, so a 50 yalm battlefield would have 50,000 for this field

data.name: Render Radius
data.comment: -- 20 Yalms*1000, so a fence that renders when you're 25 yalms away would have 25,000 for this field

packet.comment: Packet updated every time a party member's buffs change
Carries proposal information from a /propose or /nominate command

data.name: _unknown?
data.comment: -- 08 Proposal ID?

data.name: Chat mode
data.comment: -- 1D Not typical chat mode mapping. 1 = Party

data.name: Proposal
data.comment: -- 1E Proposal text, complete with special characters

packet.comment: Proposal update following a /vote command

data.name: _unknown?-- 08 Likely contains information about the current chat mode and vote count

packet.comment: Buy an item from a guild
Provides the items, prices, and counts for guild inventories
Sell an item to a guild
Provides the items, prices, and counts for guild inventories
Sent to update the current guild status or open the guild buy/sell menu

data.name: Guild Shop Status
data.comment: 0 = open 1 = closed 2 = holiday

data.name: _junk?
data.comment: -- 05 Does not seem to matter in any permutation of this packet

data.name: Guild Hours Data
data.comment: -- 08 First 1 indicates the opening hour. First 0 after that indicates the closing hour. In the event that there are no 0s, 91022244 is used.

data.name: _flags?
data.comment: -- 0B Most significant bit (0x80) indicates whether the close guild message should be displayed.

packet.comment: Contains all merit information. 3 packets are sent

data.name: _unknown?
data.comment: Always 00 0F 01

packet.comment: Contains all job point information. 12 packets are sent.

Packet that shows the skills and abilities that you know

Sent when you open the Help Desk submenu
Sent to inform the client about the status of entry to an instanced area
Updates all party member info in one struct. No player vital data (HP/MP/TP) or names are sent here
Shows another player your equipment after using the Check command

data.name: Icon Set Subtype
data.comment: 0 = Unopened Linkshell?, 1 = Linkshell, 2 = Pearlsack, 3 = Linkpearl, 4 = Ripped Pearlsack (I think), 5 = Broken Linkpearl?

data.name: Icon Set ID
data.comment: This identifies the icon set, always 2 for linkshells.

packet.comment: Shows another players bazaar message after using the Check command or sets your own on zoning

data.name: Unknown 0x00?
data.comment: -- 16 Seems to always be 00

data.name: _unknown?
data.comment: -- 17 Seemingly random, both 00 and FF observed, as well as many values in between

packet.comment: Sent when someone casts a lot on an item or when the item drops to someone

data.comment: -- 11 Always seems set if we have a index ?

data.name: Current Lot
data.comment: -- 12 0xFF FF if passing

data.name: Drop Type
data.comment: -- 15 0 if no drop, 1 if dropped to player, 3 if floored

packet.comment: Causes Records of Eminence messages

Contains all currencies to be displayed in the currency menu
Contains information about the fish that you hooked
Returned from the server when building a set
Returned from the server after the /equipset command
Contains all currencies to be displayed in the currency menu
Contains the currently available job abilities and their remaining recast times

Newly created parser.

data.name: Offset Position
data.comment: non-zero values only observed for geo spells cast using a repositioned subtarget

packet.comment: Sent in response to a /volunteer command.
Requests a server message (e.g. /servmes).

data.name: Message Chuck
data.comment: The current chunk of the message to send.. (1 = start, 2 = rest of message)

data.name: Message Type
data.comment: 1 = server message, 2 = fish ranking results

data.name: Timestamp
data.comment: The message timestamp being requested

data.name: Message Size Total
data.comment: The total length of the requested server message

data.name: Message Offset
data.comment: The offset to start obtaining the server message..

data.name: Message Request Length
data.comment: The total requested size of send to the client..

packet.comment: This command is used to equip your character.
Selecting a dialog option

data.name: Action
data.comment: 2 = Check hook, 3 = Hook Action, 4 = End, 5 = Time Warning

data.name: Status Code
data.comment: 0-100=Fish Stamina % when catching, 200=Give Up after Hook, 201=Cancel before hook, 300=Out of Time

data.name: Special
data.comment: Same as Special received from incomming 0x115 (Fish Bite)
